question.body: Which of the following is not gray matter?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The cortical brain tissue is gray, while spinal gray matter is found medullary.

Correct. These are white matter structures connecting right and left sides; in the brain they are anterior and posterior to the corpus callosum while in the spinal cord they are anterior and posterior to the gray commissure.
Incorrect. These are gray matter areas deep in the brain, even though the majority of brain gray matter is part of the outer cortex.
Incorrect. These are spinal column gray matter structures.
Incorrect. This is spinal column gray matter structure, although not present in all parts for the spinal cord.

part.hint: In general, location of white and gray matter in brain and spinal cord are reversed.

question.body: Which of the following would not have neuron cell bodies?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This contains the cell bodies of neurons synapsing with sensory neurons entering the spinal cord.
Incorrect. This contains cell bodies of somatic motor neurons.
Incorrect. This contains cell bodies of sympathetic motor neurons.
Correct. This contains ascending and descending tracts of neuron axons.
Incorrect. This contains cell bodies of neurons connecting right and left sides of spinal cord.

part.hint: Neuron cell bodies would be associated with gray matter, not myelinated white matter.
